p: In terms of the priority health risks examined in the assessment, vector-borne diseases and food security were identified as having the greatest number of barriers to effective adaptation [ 16]. Dominica is engaged in a number of climate change resiliency building projects and initiatives at international, regional, and national levels. Table 4 identifies examples of programs, initiatives, and partners that are helping increase the countryâ€™s capacity to adapt to the health impacts of climate change.
